intro: Seguieria guaranitica var. microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved papyrus, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, marshy environments and is often found in regions with seasonal flooding. Its unique botanical characteristics make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland conservation.
